badge_template_activities.title: Understanding Change the earner is able to Identify and demonstrate how innovation and organisation change can contribute to enhanced business performance. Explain and assess the impact and importance of sustainability to business entities. Research and recommend solutions for improving performance of a business entity

Analysis of Financial Information the earner is able to calculate ratios and analyse financial performance for a business entity. Analyse and interpret financial information to inform decision-making for a business entity. Evaluate debtor risk and apply relevant actions to mitigate these risks.

Applied Accounting the earner is able to process a wide range of transactions to Trial Balance. Record accounting processes for a GST registered business using accounting software. Apply the accounting profession’s Code of Ethics to given situations. Research and communicate on technical issues of a business.

Budgets for Planning and Control the earner is able to prepare budgets and monitor performance against budgets for a GST registered person Prepare budgets and use budgets to monitor performance for a business. Determine internal controls to minimise financial risk for a business entity

badge_template_activities.title: In this government funded Trades Academy Secondary School course, the learner gained skills in: Engines, automotive components and engineering hand tools as well as knowledge of hazardous materials, fasteners, good work habits and safe work practices Students attend classes once a week for 28 weeks.

Learners have been assessed and can demonstrate knowledge of the operation of two and four stroke engines; Learners have been assessed and are able to clean automotive components; can assemble typical mechanical components such as levers, bearings, seals, shafts, motors, chains, belts, pulleys, sprockets, frames fasteners, keys and tools such as screw drivers, spanners, pliers, torque wrench and Allen keys

Learners have been assessed and can demonstrate and apply knowledge of the selection, use and care of engineering hand tools in the range of cutting tools such as hacksaws, chisels, files, hole punches, tin snips and assembly tools such as hammers, punches, vices, clamps, spanners, wrenches and pliers;

Learners have been assessed and can demonstrate knowledge of hazardous materials used in the motor industry in the range of paint materials, chemicals, solvents, petrol/oil, adhesives, cleaning materials, rags, masking materials, plastic materials, chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), air bag, acids and anti-freeze.

Learners have been assessed and can identify fasteners commonly used in mechanical engineering such as screws and bolts including various types of heads and self-tapping screws; different types of nuts including locking nuts; plain, spring, and serrated washers; various types of pins including cotter pins; circlips; masonry anchors; adhesives and outline their uses; and demonstrate knowledge of threaded fasteners ISO – Classes 8.8 and 10.9 and Imperial – SAE Grades 2, 5, and 8.
Learners have been assessed and can demonstrate knowledge of good work habits and safe work practices in the automotive industry;

67192a1a-be59-43f9-a012-937394d4c984.description: Earners of the Trades Academy Horticulture NCEA Level 2 badge have completed supervised horticultural skills through Hawke’s Bay School’s Trades Academy at EIT (Eastern Institute of Technology) or Tairāwhiti. alignments.description: People credited with this unit standard are able to: identify and describe environmental factors which influence plant growth; plant breeding and crop management and their influence on plant growth; and explain factors and techniques than enhance plant growth for a specific crop.

alignments.description: This unit standard is for people working or intending to work in the horticultural industry. People credited with this unit standard are able to: demonstrate knowledge of fencing tools and construction materials, and describe their function; maintain fencing tools and equipment; and identify and describe fencing wire types and their uses.

alignments.name: NZQA Unit Standard 27708: Demonstrate knowledge of sexual and asexual plant propagation, Level 2, 6 credits, Version 1
alignments.description: This unit standard is for people working or intending to work in the horticultural industry. badge_template_activities.title: In this course the learner gained skills in: Using tractors for horticultural work; Factors influencing plant growth; Fencing tools and equipment ; Knowledge of sexual and asexual plant propagation

Learners have been assessed and passed a range of items including: Open a coil of wire, draw out and cut, prepare to retie the roll, tie termination and join knots in wire, join wires by alternative or non-tied means; prepare wire for transport and storage under supervision; Using equipment and materials for fencing; maintaining fencing tools and equipment, identifying wire types and uses under supervision.

Learners have been assessed and passed a range of items including: Factors which influence plant growth, plant breeding and crop management and influences on plant growth, factors and techniques that enhance plant growth on a specific crop; The differences between sexual and asexual plant propagation; propagation of plants from seed, division and cuttings; plant breeders rights

alignments.description: People credited with this unit standard are able to construct and refine taonga pūoro.

badge_template_activities.title: In this course the learner gained skills in: Use traditional and contemporary construction techniques to make Māori visual art; Use design knowledge to make Māori visual art ; Learn appropriate karakia and tikanga in relation to Māori visual art; Explore painting, whakairo and making taonga puoro; Exhibit your work within the Vent Gallery at IDEAschool

Learners have been assessed and passed a range of items including: Demonstrate knowledge of whakairo production for meaning, intention, function and an artist’s methodologies; Demonstrate knowledge of function and significance to explore the value of whakairo; Construct simple taonga puoro; Apply Māori art conventions, designs and practices to develop whakairo; Develop ideas to create whakairo; Construct and refine taonga puoro

f0312a8e-15eb-440e-8c8a-8ee13115ec80.description: The holder of this badge has developed the skills and knowledge related to food cost control measures to improve the financial performance of commercial kitchen operations. In particular they have correctly calculated accurate food costs, applied portion and waste: control measures and evaluated menu engineering data.
f0312a8e-15eb-440e-8c8a-8ee13115ec80.name: Food Costing Introduction

alignments.name: NZQA Level 5 Micro-credential
alignments.description: The course completed by the holder, has been assessed inline with the NZ Qualifications Authority, to a level 5 standard, on the NZ Qualifications Framework.

badge_template_activities.title: The successful learner has correctly analysed an actual menu from a restaurant using menu engineering  tools
The successful learner has costed an entire menu – minimum 2 entrees, 2 main and 2 desserts

bd9d37ff-52b2-4c11-972d-0bb0ebdfbc81.description: The holder of this EduBit has planned and facilitated community led development hui/meetings/workshops for a diverse range of groups and critically reflected on practice to enhance their own facilitation and outcomes for local communities.
bd9d37ff-52b2-4c11-972d-0bb0ebdfbc81.name: Inspiring Communities: Community-Led Development Facilitation - 2022

alignments.name: New Zealand Qualifications Authority
alignments.description: This EduBit is recognised as equivalent to 10 credits on the NZQF at Level 5 and has been awarded by Otago Polytechnic, a NZQA accredited Category One provider.

badge_template_activities.title: Apply community-led development principles and understanding of group process to plan community hui/meetings/workshops for a diverse range of groups.
Apply an adaptive approach to facilitate hui/meetings/workshops to support constructive group interaction, participation and outcomes in a diverse range of the community-led development contexts
Critically reflect on facilitation practice in a diverse range of community led development contexts to enhance facilitation practice.

8800dc38-8658-49ee-ad75-6995dfc26a9e.description: Earners of the Introduction to the Treaty of Waitangi badge have built their understanding of the treaty and learnt how to create a partnership of respect and trust across their organisation.
8800dc38-8658-49ee-ad75-6995dfc26a9e.name: Introduction to the Treaty of Waitangi. Cultural Competency.

badge_template_activities.title: In this professional development workshop, the learners explore the historical and current context to the Treaty. Events that led to the need for an agreement between Māori and Pākehā are discussed, and learners gain an understanding of the impact the Treaty has on language, culture and identity.

afbf0e21-df9f-40ae-9288-33fec84e39ef.description: A Restricted Area Entry Certification (RAEC) is required to be able to access all electrical network provider facilities in New Zealand. This badge certifies competence in managing your health and safety around electricity, electrical equipment, and the Orion network assets. The badge is valid from the date of issue for up to 2 years.
afbf0e21-df9f-40ae-9288-33fec84e39ef.name: Orion Restricted Area Entry Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Energy Academy: Restricted Area Entry - Orion Certificate online modules and attended an on-site workshop.

skills.name: Able To Comply With Electrical Safe Working Practices And Safe Area Classifications
Complying With Health & Safety And Environmental Legislation

e209ba56-4774-4e1b-b3c8-5678110c8961.description: The Kia haumaru! Kia matatū! micro-credential recognises that earners are familiar with SafePlus principles and practices to enable healthier, safer and more productive work in Aotearoa New Zealand. Badge earners know and can apply present-day principles of effective leadership, worker engagement and risk management. They are familiar with the SafePlus health and safety improvement toolkit and can identify the range of services provided by New Zealand’s health and safety profession.
e209ba56-4774-4e1b-b3c8-5678110c8961.name: SafePlus Kia Haumaru! Kia Matatū! (Be safe, be alert!)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the SafePlus Kia haumaru! Kia matatū! mico-credential course work.

Earners of this badge have achieved the pass mark of 80% in the three assessment tasks for the SafePlus Kia haumaru! Kia matatū! micro-credential. They have been assessed as showing ability to understand and apply present-day health and safety principles, including the hierarchy of controls to manage risk, and can identify the range of services provided by New Zealand’s health and safety profession. Badge earners have the capability to enable and support healthier, safer and more productive work
SafePlus Rau Tūwhera (Principles and practices)
SafePlus Taku Whare Tapa Whā (Healthy work)

b9859e04-d44b-424f-bb6f-32c6e3ef6e73.description: The Kia haumaru! Kia matatū! micro-credential recognises that earners are familiar with SafePlus principles and practices to enable healthier, safer and more product work in Aotearoa New Zealand. The Rau tūwhera badge earner knows present-day principles for growing worker participation in making work healthier and safer for everyone. They are familiar with the SafePlus health and safety improvement toolkit and how to apply SafePlus principles to improve outcomes at work.
b9859e04-d44b-424f-bb6f-32c6e3ef6e73.name: SafePlus Rau Tūwhera (Principles and practices)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed Module 1: He oranga, Module 3: Ngā kawa whakahaere, and Module 4: Te whakaū of the Safeplus Kia haumaru! Kia matatū! micro-credential course work.

Earners of this badge have achieved the pass mark of 80% in assessment 2 of Kia haumaru! Kia matatū!, demonstrating understanding and application of SafePlus principles and practices. They have been assessed as showing ability to understand and apply present-day health and safety principles and practises to improve work outcomes in Aotearoa New Zealand.

9531d446-3710-4e17-a3ae-522e4da9bb26.description: The Kia haumaru! Kia matatū! micro-credential recognises that earners are familiar with SafePlus principles and practices to enable healthier, safer and more product work. The Taku whare tapa whā badge earner knows principles and practices that support health and wellbeing at work, and can apply the Te whare tapa whā health model in an Aotearoa New Zealand work context.
9531d446-3710-4e17-a3ae-522e4da9bb26.name: SafePlus Taku Whare Tapa Whā (Healthy work)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the SafePlus Taku whare tapa whā online module

Earners of this badge have achieved the assessment pass mark of 80% to show their understanding of health and wellbeing at work concepts, and their ability to apply the Te whare tapa whā health model to work in Aotearoa New Zealand

c8288a62-ba33-4aa2-84c4-3580fced255f.description: Earners of the Southbase Construction Commercial Level 1 certification have demonstrated fundamental understanding of merchant invoicing, Subcontractor management and payment processes for commercial construction projects.
c8288a62-ba33-4aa2-84c4-3580fced255f.name: Southbase Construction Commercial – Level 1 Certification

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this competency the learner must demonstrate comprehension of the following elements of payments in relation to commercial construction. • CP-05 – Subcontractor Management • CP-06 – Subcontractor Payments and Variations • CP-07 – Plus One • CP-09 – Client Payment Claims

3a766b13-534e-4020-8157-49a90f0646ab.description: Earners of the Southbase Construction Commercial Level 2 certification have demonstrated fundamental understanding of supplier engagement processes, forecasting and month end procedures for commercial construction projects.
3a766b13-534e-4020-8157-49a90f0646ab.name: Southbase Construction Commercial – Level 2 Certification

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this competency the learner must demonstrate comprehension and practical application of the following elements of payments in relation to commercial construction. CP-03 Supplier Engagement – Standard Subcontractor  CP-04 Supplier Engagement – Non-Standard Subcontractor  CP-10 Client Variations  CP-12 Workbench Forecast and Month End Lock off  CP-13 Risk and Opportunity  CP-14  Internal Reporting – Commercial

3a8ac8eb-77ba-4553-b207-6e495e88cf25.description: Earners of the Southbase Construction Compliance Certified Badge have demonstrated fundamental understanding of HSE and operating processes for commercial construction projects.
3a8ac8eb-77ba-4553-b207-6e495e88cf25.name: Southbase Construction Compliance Certified Badge

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this competency the learner must demonstrate comprehension of key Operation skills in relation to a Compliance role in commercial construction. The earner must gain the OPS Core Badge, HSE Level 1 Badge  and show a practical knowledge of key southbase systems for managing, monitoring and accurately reporting on key project information.

c665c7a5-472b-469f-84d0-0c55ac8689be.description: Earners of this badge have participated in leadership training and demonstrated practical understanding of key leadership practise. Recipients have attended Leadership Development Training and Time Management training, They have completed a Core Strengths (SDI 2.0) Assessment and attended Relationship Intelligence Workshops. They have demonstrated skills in SMART Goal Setting, and have sourced out inspirational leadership models which they can integrate into their own leadership style.
c665c7a5-472b-469f-84d0-0c55ac8689be.name: Southbase Construction Leadership Core

badge_template_activities.title: Description (Up to 500 characters): To earn this competency the learner must complete a Core Strengths Assessment and participate in Emotional Intelligence Training. This covers a persons Motives, Conflict Sequence, Strengths and Communication Style.

To earn this competency, learners must complete a range of Leadership Development Workshops specifically designed for Southbase Construction. These workshops cover essential leadership skills, team leadership, communication and managing performance.
Participants are required to research leadership styles and find practical tips that they can incorporate into their own leadership role. They also provide evidence of SMART Goal setting.

5bdd1b9e-a233-442f-b459-09c55b41f547.description: Earners of the Southbase Construction PM Certified Badge have demonstrated fundamental HSE and operating processes for commercial construction projects.
5bdd1b9e-a233-442f-b459-09c55b41f547.name: Southbase Construction Project Manager Certified Badge

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this competency the learner must demonstrate comprehension of key Operations competencies in relation to a Project Manager role in commercial construction, showing practical knowledge across key areas of project management including Client Management, Health, Safety & Environmental, Quality Assurance, Programming, Cost and Risk Management. The earner must also gain the OPS Core Badge and HSE Level 2 Badge.

ea4ee9f9-edf5-4d51-8f26-85aec939a904.description: Earners of the Southbase Construction SM Certified Badge have demonstrated fundamental understanding of HSE and operating processes for commercial construction projects.
ea4ee9f9-edf5-4d51-8f26-85aec939a904.name: Southbase Construction Site Manager Certified Badge

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this competency the learner must demonstrate comprehension of key Operations competencies in relation to a Site Manager role in commercial construction showing practical evidence of their knowledge on managing a site, including Health, Safety & Environmental Management, Quality Assurance, Programming, Subcontractor Management and Risk Management. The earner must also gain the OPS Core Badge and HSE Level 2 Badge.

e0a1b7df-37c4-48a8-ab1b-b1cd8cf9a935.description: The holder of this badge has the skills and knowledge required to apply conflict resolution techniques in the workplace.
e0a1b7df-37c4-48a8-ab1b-b1cd8cf9a935.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Conflict Resolution

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the Future Ready: Conflict Resolution course successfully, and it has been assessed that they can 1) Identify personal perspectives to workplace conflict and the different types of conflict in the workplace , 2) identify active listening skills Identify ways to respond to workplace conflict 3) Identify conflict resolution techniques and describe how they can improve your leadership skills in the workplace

b6a55f45-9542-4d0f-b7ec-16853d0a6400.description: The holder of this badge will have skills and knowledge of how to lead others from a Pasifka.
b6a55f45-9542-4d0f-b7ec-16853d0a6400.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Leadership Confidence

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the Future Ready: Leadership and Confidence course successfully, and it has been assessed that they can (1) Identify and describe leadership strengths (2) Identify leadership skills and traits to develop. (3) Identify ways to communicate with people from different backgrounds and cultures. (4) Identify active listening skills.

4f05d8b7-2b6c-4918-b1e7-203fa2e65d0f.description: The holder of this badgehastheskills and knowledge to effectively select and safely utilise digital technologies to improve theirpersonal or professional life.
4f05d8b7-2b6c-4918-b1e7-203fa2e65d0f.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Life Online 2

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed theFuture Ready: Life Online 2 course successfully, and it has been assessed that they can 1) Select appropriate digital devices and software for the purposes of learning, sharing, and communicating safely, appropriately, and effectively with others. 2) Apply digital skills and knowledge to a personal or professional area of life with the purpose of improving digital capability.

d7bb3797-f987-42e5-a07f-ef6bb65e6177.description: The holder of this badge is able to understand and apply basic financial management skills and knowledge, to improve an area of personal need.
d7bb3797-f987-42e5-a07f-ef6bb65e6177.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Money Confidence 2

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the Future Ready: Money Confidence 2 course successfully, and it has been assessed that they can 1) Demonstrate an understanding of good and bad debt. 2) Set a personal financial goal in relation to an area of need/interest using an online tool. 3) Apply a basic financial management plan to improve a personal financial area of interest/need. 4) Reflect and review progress towards a personal financial goal.

07592c05-4e98-4580-bd87-ff2029b5a07a.description: The holder of this badge has the skills and knowledge of how to apply financial knowledge and techniques to get into home ownership
07592c05-4e98-4580-bd87-ff2029b5a07a.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Preparing for Home Ownership

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this Preparing for Home Ownership badge has the skills to: Identify personal considerations towards home ownership. Show knowledge of Kiwisaver and mortgages as tools towards home ownership. Identify what it means to use a professional advisor to assist with the home ownership process . Show knowledge of First Home Partner as a pathway to home ownership. Set a personal financial goal towards home ownership and describe steps taken toward the achievement of that goal.

f6686c31-b2ef-48db-b79e-46fc98662e0b.description: The holder of this badge will have skills to apply knowledge of superannuation and Kiwisaver to prepare for their financial future/retirement.
f6686c31-b2ef-48db-b79e-46fc98662e0b.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Preparing for your retirement

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the Future Ready: Prepare for your Retirement course successfully and it has been assessed that they can (1) Explain personal considerations for retirement planning (2) Set a personal financial goal towards retirement and describe steps taken toward the achievement of that goal (3) Show knowledge of Kiwisaver as a retirement tool (4) Evaluate superannuation and Kiwisaver to financially plan for retirement.

00d9dde8-12e9-4c74-91f1-e2f059a0712d.description: The holder of this badge will have skills to use the wellbeing principles to enhance both their professional and personal lives.
00d9dde8-12e9-4c74-91f1-e2f059a0712d.name: Tātaki Auckland Unlimited: Future Ready. Wellbeing

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the Future Ready: Wellbeing course and it has been assessed that they can (1) Identify ways of achieving wellbeing (1) Apply wellbeing methods to daily life (3) Describe the role nutrition and movement play in your wellbeing (4) Identify ways to maintain a balanced lifestyle to enhance overall wellbeing.
